eposap:SoftwareApplication.dct:title: GLASS (GNSS Linkage Advanced Software System)
eposap:SoftwareApplication.dct:description: GLASS (GNSS Linkage Advanced Software System) is an integrated software package suitable for deployment in a GNSS infrastructure. Its main purpose is to manage, validate, and distribute GNSS data & metadata and associated products. GLASS provides a mean to manage GNSS data (RINEX & metadata) from distributed repositories/data centers through operational tasks like collecting, validation and dissemination of data and metadata. It provides also GNSS products like: Coordinate Daily and Time Series, Velocity Fields and Strain Rate Fields. GLASS is being developed in the framework of European Plate Observing System Implementation Phase (EPOS-IP) until 2019 and will be used in the GNSS component of EPOS Operational Phase (EPOS-OP) after 2019. The GLASS package includes a data repository, M3G software, data and products portals. All these interconnected components are aggregated in a software package that can be installed in a stand-alone server but its main goal is to be installed in a GNSS network to facilitate the integration of individual repositories/data centers. A first version prototype is expected to be available for testing in late Summer 2017. It is developed within WP10 DDSS-018.
